intro: Chrysanthemum subglaucum, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysanthemum, is a perennial herb native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and is also used in traditional medicine. The species is closely related to other members of the Chrysanthemum genus, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants.
